newsletter.title: Event Recap: Haymaker Happy Hour
newsletter.description: Professionals and students joined together for a Happy Hour at the Haymaker on March 24th.

newsletter.title: Volunteers Needed for Family Science Night @ LBJ
newsletter.description:
SHPE Austin will be hosting Family Science Night (Noche De Ciencias), a bilingual event that targets Austin area families, to garner interest in STEM and provide valuable information on how to prepare students for a future in a STEM field.  There will be free food and many fun activities - so bring yourself and your family! In addition, SHPE Austin is looking for volunteers to help out the day of the event. Those interested can sign-up HERE. 
Date: April 7th (6:30-9:30PM) at Lyndon B. Johnson High School.

newsletter.title: Battle it out with SHPEy's
newsletter.description: Join the student and professional SHPE chapters over friendly competition and good food. Date: April 10th (2-5PM) University Village Apts.(1301 Crossing Place 78741)If you have any questions, send us an email

newsletter.title: We're SHPE'ing out Scholarships
newsletter.description:
Thank you to everyone who applied for SHPE Austin Scholarships. The scholarship application is now closed. Selected candidates will be notified by April 15th. If you have any questions, please contact our Scholarships Director, Karen Siles. 


Click on the image to access the SHPE NATIONAL scholarships

newsletter.title: Survey for Spring Sports
newsletter.description:
If you are interested in playing a sport with a "Professional" team in a friendly league, join the SHPE Austin Athletic team. We encourage players from all levels to come have a blast with us in Softball, Volleyball, Kickball, and more. For more information contact Carlos Pizarro.

Click on the image to access the survey

newsletter.title: Volunteers Needed for Latinitas Code Chica Conference 2016
newsletter.description: SHPE Austin seeks volunteers to help out at the Latinitas Code Chica Conference next month. This event will teach girls how to use media and technology to design, code and market their own mobile app idea. Roles we are looking to assist with include: workshop assistant, lunchtime crew, clean up crew, event historian, photographer, and more. If you would like to register a participant or donate a registration pass click HERE. Date: April 16th (9AM-4PM) at ACC Eastview Campus
